lexUnit.name: exhaustion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: state of being (virtually) incapable of further exertion.

sentence.text: She sat with her until the exhaustion of grief finally drove Ana to sleep and silence , then Maggie went to wait for Felipe .
They smiled as I hammed up my exhaustion , then carried on effortlessly climbing .
Against this we had to set our growing exhaustion , and increasingly dysfunctional limbs .
Louise was still asleep in the back , her exhaustion now complete .
Fen , still wanting to be rid of her , had taken advantage of her utter exhaustion to abandon her here .
In spite of their exhaustion , their jubilation at making the longest unsupported polar trip and the first unsupported crossing of Antarctica was unmistakeable .
As we squelched along the road and into the farmyard I felt a feeling of utter exhaustion .
On a curving ridge-walk like this , the last Munro staying within sight all the way can either be immensely heartening or terrifically dispiriting , depending on your state of exhaustion .
On and on she would lure him , enticing him to cut every sheaf left in the meadow , until midnight came and he was faint with exhaustion .
Susan and Claire , the wives of Stephen and Alan , looked on wanly , speechless with exhaustion .
By ten that evening Polly was literally reeling with exhaustion .
It 's what I want , " she mumbled in exhaustion .
When she finally slept , tear-stained , he felt no relief , only an enormous exhaustion .
Sara 's legs were trembling with exhaustion by the time she reached the stables .
If that fury were given expression , the person in question would die of exhaustion within a week .
She died of exhaustion within a year .
Suddenly Lee saw the exhaustion in the folds of skin beneath her mother 's eyes .
I will never forget the day Mike collapsed with complete exhaustion .
But Katherine Lundy did n't believe in omens ; she imagined her untroubled night 's sleep was due to nothing more than complete exhaustion .
As everyone was by then in a state of complete exhaustion they did little for the next two or three days except sleep .
The individual 's powers of recovery can be impaired by physical and mental exhaustion , as there are no reserves of energy to overcome the crisis .
Mental and physical exhaustion ensured that Hilary slept deeply , and it was well after ten when she finally stirred .
They were young enough to cope with the physical exhaustion but trying to memorize so many routines became unbearable .
It was just pure physical exhaustion and then collapse .
What had settled his son at last was sheer exhaustion , and Alan 's absence .

McAllister really did think that she was going to faint this time , not through shock or disgust , but sheer physical exhaustion , except that the will which her family deplored kept her on her feet .
They can not be attacked in hand-to-hand combat either -- the only way to destroy a Fanatic is to shoot him or to wait and let him collapse from exhaustion .
They too were suffering from exhaustion after recent events , and had less energy to carry Charles ; their main concern was just to keep themselves going .
A year later he collapsed from exhaustion but insisted in carrying on with eight shows a week .
Victoria said , ` You are recovered from your exhaustion , Shelley ? "
